title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, a top NFL Draft prospect, expressed enthusiasm about potentially working with Tom Brady at the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, a 22-year-old Heisman Trophy winner from Indiana, is projected as the No. 1 overall pick in the 2026 NFL Draft.
Though eager for mentoring from Brady, Mendoza remains open to any team, valuing the draft experience over a guaranteed selection.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided while pursuing a fly ball during the Red Sox's spring training game.
Both players stayed in the game after trainers evaluated them, with Anthony later hitting a single and Rafaela a two-run homer.
Manager Alex Cora attributed the collision to miscommunication, as both players initially thought they had the catch.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund if a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's pledge would be his largest public donation to the Jimmy Fund, which supports cancer research at Dana-Farber.
In 2025, Trevor Story and Wilyer Abreu were the only Red Sox to hit 20 home runs, reaching 25 and 22, respectively.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, restricting critical race theory and LGBTQ+ topics in schools.
The bill passed 184–164, with opposition from all Democrats and four Republicans, moving to the Senate next.
Violations could lead to teacher credential revocation or lawsuits against schools up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2's Hairpin Turn in North Adams are created with food coloring by locals.
The tradition of coloring icicles has been practiced in North Adams for decades, involving water balloons and supersoakers.
Hairpin Turn, constructed in 1914, offers views of Hoosac Valley and Mount Greylock, and hosts The Golden Eagle Restaurant.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms first two measles cases of 2026, involving a school-aged child and an adult in Greater Boston.
The Boston-area adult with measles visited multiple locations while infectious, prompting health officials to trace contacts.
U.S. faces a large measles outbreak with 1,136 cases nationwide in 2026; vaccination rates keep Massachusetts risk low.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident, died on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
She was a City of Boston Inspectional Services member and famously appeared in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial with Rob Gronkowski.
Morgan is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello, her children Mya and Frankie, and her extended family.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor her father who died from ALS.
Hamilton aims to raise awareness and fight for better ALS treatments through her marathon participation.
Her father, a former Boston salesman, inspired her deep connection to the city and the marathon.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion after AG Andrea Campbell moved to strike her audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio seeks a special assistant attorney general appointment to represent her in a conflict with legislative leaders.
Campbell argues the lawsuit lacks authorization, citing her role as a 'gatekeeper' for state legal disputes.
